# MTLFunctionStitchingAttribute

**Protocol**

A protocol to identify types that customize how the Metal compiler stitches a function together.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol MTLFunctionStitchingAttribute : NSObjectProtocol
```

## Stitched function libraries

- **Customizing shaders using function pointers and stitching**: Define custom shader behavior at runtime by creating functions from existing ones and preferentially linking to others in a dynamic library.
- **MTLStitchedLibraryDescriptor**: A description of a new library of procedurally generated functions.
- **MTLFunctionStitchingGraph**: A description of a new stitched function.
- **MTLFunctionStitchingInputNode**: A call graph node that describes an input to the call graph.
- **MTLFunctionStitchingFunctionNode**: A call graph node that describes a function call and its inputs.
- **MTLFunctionStitchingNode**: A protocol to identify call graph nodes.
- **MTLFunctionStitchingAttributeAlwaysInline**: An attribute to specify that Metal needs to inline all of the function calls when generating the stitched function.

## Inherits From

- NSObjectProtocol

## Conforming Types

- MTLFunctionStitchingAttributeAlwaysInline
